function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Incomplete assessment of SARS-CoV-2 prevalence in wastewater may lead to underestimation of infection rates","Impact":"Unidentified spread of COVID-19 due to lack of accurate data","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough validation and verification of mass balance calculations, and consider implementing additional sampling methods","Technologies":"RT-qPCR, Monte Carlo simulation, network analysis using ESRI ArcGIS","People":"Public health officials, researchers, wastewater management professionals","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, wastewater treatment organizations"},{"Description":"Uncertainty in decay rate calculations may result in inaccurate estimation of virus survivability in wastewater","Impact":"Misjudgment of virus decay and potential for longer survivability in wastewater","Mitigation":"Use more robust methods for decay rate calculations and validate results with experimental data","Technologies":"Arrhenius equation, Monte Carlo simulation, mathematical modeling","People":"Public health officials, researchers, wastewater management professionals","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, wastewater treatment organizations"},{"Description":"Inaccurate modeling of virus spreading in smart cities may lead to ineffective pandemic control measures","Impact":"Inadequate response to virus spread in urban areas due to flawed modeling","Mitigation":"Validate and calibrate the mathematical model with real-world data, and involve urban planning experts in the modeling process","Technologies":"Mathematical modeling, smart city technologies, urban planning tools","People":"Public health officials, urban planners, researchers","Owner":"Public health agencies, local government"}]}
